Authors:
Thiago Accioly, Rhudson Henrique Santos Ferreira Cruz,
Nathalia Assis Mendonca, Noemia Kazue Ishikawa, Kentaro Hosaka, M. P.
Martin, Iuri Goulart Baseia
Title:
Amazonian birdâ€™s nest fungi (Basidiomycota): current
knowledge and novelties on Cyathus species
Keywords:
Gasteroid fungi, integrative taxonomy, Molecular
phylogenetics, Neotropics, Nidulariaceae.
Abstract:
The genus Cyathus is historically subsampled in the Amazon
Forest, which is a potential source of striking taxonomic richness.
There is an urgency to know biodiversity in this megadiverse area before
the current species become extinct due to human action. In this paper, a
checklist of Amazonian Cyathus species with detailed descriptions and
illustrations of five uncommon species are given. A new species named C.
albinus is proposed, and three other species are recorded for the first
time from their localities. Also, polyphyly is detected into Striatum
infra-generic group.
